com.turn.ttorrent.client

Class SharedTorrent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.ttorrent.common.Torrent
      • com.turn.ttorrent.client.SharedTorrent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PeerActivityListener, EventListener

    public class SharedTorrent
extends Torrent
implements PeerActivityListener
    A torrent shared by the BitTorrent client.

    The SharedTorrent class extends the Torrent class with all the data and logic required by the BitTorrent client implementation.

    Note: this implementation currently only supports single-file torrents.

    Author:
    mpetazzoni

    • Constructor Detail

      • SharedTorrent

        public SharedTorrent(Torrent torrent,
                     File destDir)
              throws FileNotFoundException,
                     IOException
        Create a new shared torrent from a base Torrent object.

        This will recreate a SharedTorrent object from the provided Torrent object's encoded meta-info data.

        Parameters:
        torrent - The Torrent object.
        destDir - The destination directory or location of the torrent files.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the torrent file location or destination directory does not exist and can't be created.
        IOException - If the torrent file cannot be read or decoded.

      • SharedTorrent

        public SharedTorrent(Torrent torrent,
                     File destDir,
                     boolean seeder)
              throws FileNotFoundException,
                     IOException
        Create a new shared torrent from a base Torrent object.

        This will recreate a SharedTorrent object from the provided Torrent object's encoded meta-info data.

        Parameters:
        torrent - The Torrent object.
        destDir - The destination directory or location of the torrent files.
        seeder - Whether we're a seeder for this torrent or not (disables validation).
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the torrent file location or destination directory does not exist and can't be created.
        IOException - If the torrent file cannot be read or decoded.

        public long getDownloaded()
        Get the number of bytes downloaded for this torrent.

        Note: this could be more than the torrent's length, and should not be used to determine a completion percentage.

      • init

        public void init()
          throws InterruptedException,
                 IOException
        Build this torrent's pieces array.

        Hash and verify any potentially present local data and create this torrent's pieces array from their respective hash provided in the torrent meta-info.

        This function should be called soon after the constructor to initialize the pieces array.

        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        IOException

      • getAvailablePieces

        public BitSet getAvailablePieces()
        Return a copy of the bit field of available pieces for this torrent.

        Available pieces are pieces available in the swarm, and it does not include our own pieces.

      • getCompletedPieces

        public BitSet getCompletedPieces()
        Return a copy of the completed pieces bitset.

        public boolean isComplete()
        Tells whether this torrent has been fully downloaded, or is fully available locally.

      • finish

        public void finish()
            throws IOException
        Finalize the download of this torrent.

        This realizes the final, pre-seeding phase actions on this torrent, which usually consists in putting the torrent data in their final form and at their target location.

        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        TorrentByteStorage.finish()

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()

      • getCompletion

        public float getCompletion()
        Return the completion percentage of this torrent.

        This is computed from the number of completed pieces divided by the number of pieces in this torrent, times 100.

      • markCompleted

        public void markCompleted(Piece piece)
        Mark a piece as completed, decrementing the piece size in bytes from our left bytes to download counter.

      • handlePeerChoked

        public void handlePeerChoked(SharingPeer peer)
        Peer choked handler.

        When a peer chokes, the requests made to it are canceled and we need to mark the eventually piece we requested from it as available again for download tentative from another peer.

        Specified by:
        handlePeerChoked in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer that choked.

      • handlePeerReady

        public void handlePeerReady(SharingPeer peer)
        Peer ready handler.

        When a peer becomes ready to accept piece block requests, select a piece to download and go for it.

        Specified by:
        handlePeerReady in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer that became ready.

      • handlePieceAvailability

        public void handlePieceAvailability(SharingPeer peer,
                                    Piece piece)
        Piece availability handler.

        Handle updates in piece availability from a peer's HAVE message. When this happens, we need to mark that piece as available from the peer.

        Specified by:
        handlePieceAvailability in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got the update from.
        piece - The piece that became available.

      • handleBitfieldAvailability

        public void handleBitfieldAvailability(SharingPeer peer,
                                       BitSet availablePieces)
        Bit field availability handler.

        Handle updates in piece availability from a peer's BITFIELD message. When this happens, we need to mark in all the pieces the peer has that they can be reached through this peer, thus augmenting the global availability of pieces.

        Specified by:
        handleBitfieldAvailability in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got the update from.
        availablePieces - The pieces availability bit field of the peer.

      • handlePieceSent

        public void handlePieceSent(SharingPeer peer,
                            Piece piece)
        Piece upload completion handler.

        When a piece has been sent to a peer, we just record that we sent that many bytes. If the piece is valid on the peer's side, it will send us a HAVE message and we'll record that the piece is available on the peer at that moment (see handlePieceAvailability()).

        Specified by:
        handlePieceSent in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got this piece from.
        piece - The piece in question.

      • handlePieceCompleted

        public void handlePieceCompleted(SharingPeer peer,
                                 Piece piece)
                          throws IOException
        Piece download completion handler.

        If the complete piece downloaded is valid, we can record in the torrent completedPieces bit field that we know have this piece.

        Specified by:
        handlePieceCompleted in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got this piece from.
        piece - The piece in question.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • handlePeerDisconnected

        public void handlePeerDisconnected(SharingPeer peer)
        Peer disconnection handler.

        When a peer disconnects, we need to mark in all of the pieces it had available that they can't be reached through this peer anymore.

        Specified by:
        handlePeerDisconnected in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer we got this piece from.

      • handleIOException

        public void handleIOException(SharingPeer peer,
                              IOException ioe)
        Description copied from interface: PeerActivityListener
        Handler for IOException during peer operation.
        Specified by:
        handleIOException in interface PeerActivityListener
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer whose activity trigger the exception.
        ioe - The IOException object, for reporting.
